oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oath of parole issued by the Federal Government and signed by Confederate Private J. E. Pike, from Company B, 5th Tennessee Cavalry. Pike agreed to cease hostility with the United States in exchange for permission to return home undisturbed by Federal authorities.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This was a typical oath signed by captured or surrendering Confederate soldiers when released on parole in order to return to their homes on their own recognizance. It is a separate and distinct document from the "oath of allegiance" many Confederate soldiers had to sign after the general surrender of Confederate hostilities in 1865.
